steps.description: Customer browses the retailer catalogue (e.g., TESCO_1L_MILK, TESCO_500G_PASTA), adds items to basket, selects Click and Collect as fulfilment, and places the order. Business events emitted: cart_created, line_item_added, collection_option_selected, order_placed with order_id and estimated_collection_slot.
steps.businessRationale: Typical click-and-collect order placement for a weekly shop is quick but involves product discovery and selecting collection options; faster placement reduces abandonment and increases orders per session.

steps.description: Customer selects an available in-store pickup slot; system validates store capacity and shows any collection fees or time windows. Business events: slot_availability_checked, slot_selected, slot_unavailable with slot_id and store_id.
steps.businessRationale: Slot selection is a short, high-impact decision point; inability to find a slot or slow availability checks leads to abandonment or switching to delivery, directly affecting revenue and store workload.

steps.description: Customer completes payment (card, saved payment, or voucher) and receives order confirmation and collection instructions. Business events: payment_attempted, payment_succeeded, payment_failed, order_confirmation_sent with payment_provider and amount.
steps.businessRationale: Payment must be fast and reliable; payment failures cause immediate revenue loss and increase support costs. Confirmation messaging reduces no-shows and improves collection rates.

steps.description: Order is routed to the selected store's fulfilment queue; inventory is reserved and a pick list is generated for store colleagues. Business events: order_routed, inventory_reserved, picklist_created with store_id and reserved_SKUs.
steps.businessRationale: Routing and inventory reservation include synchronous checks and asynchronous store notifications; delays increase risk of inventory conflicts and reduce on-time readiness for collection windows.

steps.description: Store colleagues pick items from shelves, handle substitutions if items are out of stock, pack the order and mark it ready for collection. Business events: picking_started, substitution_offered, substitution_accepted, order_ready_for_collection with pick_time and substitution_rate.
steps.businessRationale: In-store picking is labour-intensive and subject to store load; timely picking ensures orders are ready within the selected slot and reduces customer complaints and refunds. Substitution handling affects customer satisfaction and retention.

steps.description: Customer arrives at store, checks in via app or kiosk, staff verify order and hand over items; post-collection feedback and refunds are processed if needed. Business events: customer_checked_in, order_collected, collection_failed, refund_initiated, feedback_submitted.
steps.businessRationale: Collection experience is the final touchpoint; delays or verification failures cause immediate dissatisfaction and potential refunds. Smooth handover preserves retention and encourages repeat click-and-collect usage.

name: Retail - In-Store Click and Collect Journey
